009package imagingbook.common.image.access;
010
011import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
012import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
013import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
014
015/** 
016 * Accessor for vector-valued images with arbitrary depth 
017 * (number of components).
018 *
019 */
020public abstract class VectorAccessor extends ImageAccessor {
021        
022        final int depth;
023        final ScalarAccessor[] componentAccessors;
024
025        VectorAccessor(ImageProcessor ip, int depth, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
026                super(ip, obs, ipm);
027                this.depth = depth;
028                this.componentAccessors = new ScalarAccessor[this.depth];
029                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
030                        componentAccessors[k] = makeComponentAccessor(k);
031                }
032        }
033        
034        /**
035         * To be implemented by all real sublasses of {@link ScalarAccessor}, 
036         * who know how to create an accessor object to their k-th component.
037         * See {@link RgbAccessor#makeComponentAccessor(int)} for an example.
038         * 
039         * @param k the component index
040         * @return the image accessor for the specified component
041         */
042        abstract ScalarAccessor makeComponentAccessor(int k);
043        
044        @Override
045        public int getDepth() {
046                return this.depth;
047        }
048        
049        @Override
050        public ScalarAccessor getComponentAccessor(int k) {
051                checkComponentIndex(k);
052                return componentAccessors[k];
053        }
054        
055        @Override
056        public float getVal(int u, int v, int k) {
057                checkComponentIndex(k);
058                return componentAccessors[k].getVal(u, v);
059        }
060        
061        @Override
062        public float getVal(double x, double y, int k) {
063                checkComponentIndex(k);
064                return componentAccessors[k].getVal(x, y);
065        }
066        
067        @Override
068        public void setVal(int u, int v, int k, float val) {
069                checkComponentIndex(k);
070                componentAccessors[k].setVal(u, v, val);
071        }
072        
073        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
074        
075//      @Override
076//      public void setDefaultValue(float val) {
077//              for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
078//                      componentAccessors[k].setDefaultValue(val);
079//              }
080//      }
081        
082//      @Override
083//      public void setDefaultValue(float[] vals) {
084//              if (vals.length != depth) {
085//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("default values must be of length " + depth);
086//              }
087//              for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
088//                      componentAccessors[k].setDefaultValue(vals[k]);
089//              }
090//      }
091        
092        @Override
093        void checkComponentIndex(int k) {
094                if (k < 0 || k >= depth) {
095                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("invalid component index " + k);
096                }
097        }
098
099}
